messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM. Thank you. Are they the only remaining ones? 

On 08/01/2013, at 21:43, minux.ma@gmail.com wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
> 
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go
> 
> 
> Description:
> cmd/gc, cmd/ld: update doc.go for -race
> 
> Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.com/7066052/
> 
> Affected files:
>  M src/cmd/gc/doc.go
>  M src/cmd/ld/doc.go
> 
> 
> Index: src/cmd/gc/doc.go
> ===================================================================
> --- a/src/cmd/gc/doc.go
> +++ b/src/cmd/gc/doc.go
> @@ -54,7 +54,7 @@
>        disallow importing packages not marked as safe
>    -V
>        print the compiler version
> -    -b
> +    -race
>        compile with race detection enabled
> 
> There are also a number of debugging flags; run the command with no arguments
> Index: src/cmd/ld/doc.go
> ===================================================================
> --- a/src/cmd/ld/doc.go
> +++ b/src/cmd/ld/doc.go
> @@ -56,7 +56,7 @@
>        Set the value of an otherwise uninitialized string variable.
>        The symbol name should be of the form importpath.name,
>        as displayed in the symbol table printed by "go tool nm".
> -    -b
> +    -race
>        Link with race detection libraries.
>    -B value
>        Add a NT_GNU_BUILD_ID note when using ELF.  The value
> 
>

On Tue, Jan 8, 2013 at 6:56 PM, Dave Cheney <dave@cheney.net> wrote:

> Are they the only remaining ones?

I believe so.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=75fc00aebf93 ***

cmd/gc, cmd/ld: update doc.go for -race

R=golang-dev, dave, rsc
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7066052

subject: code review 7066052: cmd/gc, cmd/ld: update doc.go for -race
